what: Background on YES for CURE mentoring
title: Background on YES for CURE mentoring
text: Program Description: Continuing Umbrella Research Experiences (CURE) program introduces Massachusetts high school college students underrepresented populations world cancer research placing real research settings local cancer research institutions. goal encourage students pursue future careers biosciences—particularly cancer research—giving practical meaning academic course work expand extend interest basic, clinical /population science research. program falls DFCI Initiative Eliminate Cancer Disparities founded 2001. Chan Zuckerberg Initiative Essential Open Source Software (EOSS) program funded Bioconductor project engage CURE support outreach cancer data science. volunteer: Help grow cancer data science workforce Help pursue goals equity inclusiveness Bring fresh eyes intuitions research efforts Explore potentials growing initiative beyond cancer data science Mentoring Opportunity: Learn 2022 summer program Students commit 8-12 weeks full-time work May 31 - August 19 2022 Provide appropriate research project,space, resources, mentorship Oversee student creation learning plan, abstract, scientific presentation projects Receive training mentoring processes, attend mandatory mentor orientation interested joining CURE mentor communites’ commitment building diverse research workforce collective effort support communities work please fill form. questions, email stvjc channing dot harvard dot edu.
